titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Church of Christ First Disciples Sunday School Secretary record 1973.302
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-09T10:07-0500

did.unittitle: Church of Christ First Disciples Sunday School Secretary record

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Church of Christ First Disciples (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.).

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Church of Christ First Disciples was organized in 1875 and was located on Sterling Place in Brooklyn.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Church of Christ First Disciples Sunday School Secretary record, 1973.302, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Arnold Streep, date unknown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Church of Christ First Disciples Sunday School Secretary record, dated 1900 to 1901 and housed in a single hardbound volume. The record lists first and last names of Sunday School officers, teachers, and students, often with home addresses.
